item.title: Overwatch: Most Overpowered Heroes Of All Time, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Ana's high healing and utility dominated season one, marking an era of unmatched power and effectiveness.
  • Moira's AoE healing ushered in the "Quad tank" meta without requiring high mechanical skill from players.
  • Brigitte's destructive release made her the most overpowered hero in Overwatch history, leading to the "GOATS" composition.

Balancing a multiplayer game like Overwatch is never an easy job. It doesn't matter how many years go by, how many updates are released, or how much the players complain; it is almost inevitable that certain characters will be stronger than others at various points in time.

However, there is a big difference between a strong hero and a downright broken one, and Overwatch has had its fair share of absurdly powerful iterations of its cast of heroes, ranging from insane healing numbers to ridiculous damage output, both for old and new heroes alike. These are the most overpowered versions of heroes in Overwatch history.

8 Ana

High Heals, Insane Utility

Ana has been around almost as long as any other character, as she was the first post-launch character introduced into the game. However, many newer players will have missed her initial wave of power that plagued season one with absurd healing numbers and a level of utility that no other character could even come close to matching.

Her kit has remained the same over the years, and she has come in and out of the meta both in combo situations and for her general power, but her introduction into the game brought with it a high pick rate and an equally high win rate that carried over into subsequent seasons thanks to her high agency, skill expression, and effectiveness in the vast majority of team-comps.

7 Moira

Bringing In A Whole New Meta

Moira exploded onto the scene in 2017 with her massive AoE healing potential that no other healer could compete with. Her kit is very simple and easy to pick up, which meant that if she was strong, any player could jump into a game and carry their team with their healing output alone, without worrying about complex mechanics or individual expression.

As was the case with many heroes, Moira's launch brought with it a meta of its own, aptly called "Quad tank." This team comp involved zero DPS characters; just a giant ball of tanks being sped around by Lucio and mass-healed by Moira. Through a war of attrition, teams had no problems taking points in seconds, and it was all thanks to the over-tuned nature of this simple yet absurd support hero.

6 Roadhog

A Tank That Also One-Shots From Across The Map

Roadhog has come in and out of relevancy several times over the course of the game, seeing huge playrates in the early days, a few dips in the middle, and a resurgence nowadays in modes like Stadium. The reason for his eb and flow presence is solely down to his hook, which one minute could pull players around 10 different walls and another would disconnect entirely.

When he was at his peak, Roadhog was one-tapping 200HP characters at range with his right-click, and basically annihilating any tank that dared to step too close. For good players, an eight-second hook cooldown meant a free kill every eight seconds, whether from an environmental execution or a massive pellet burst right to the face.

5 Sigma

Enough Shields And Damage For A Whole Team

Sigma has one of the more polarizing kits in the all of Overwatch . At launch, he had a shield that could rival Reinhardt's, a projectile consumer like D.Va, a combo that could one-shot any 200hHPhero with no counterplay available, and an insane ult that could wipe teams solo in the right circumstances. He was an unstoppable jack-of-all-trades who had no equal.

With his stun power toned down a bit, he remained a mainstay in the meta, giving birth to the double-shield compositions that relied on his utility and shield rotations to block damage and still return fire with some heavy hits. He might not be as deadly as he once was, but Sigma remains a terrifying threat on the battlefield.

4 Sombra

More Reworks Than You Can Count

Sombra is one of those heroes that Blizzard's Overwatch team can never get quite right. One minute, she's getting her ultimate in 30 seconds; the next, she can one-shot a support with no counterplay. Throughout her time in the game, there have been plenty of moments where she shone bright, but none were more oppressive than her release version.

The reason her first iteration was the strongest was that she could not only hack health packs, but could gain ultimate charge from the healing done by them, both on teammates and herself. This meant that, during the first fight of a match, it wasn't uncommon to see an EMP come out straight away, something which was quickly nerfed into the ground but still left her feeling pretty damn OP.

3 Mercy

The Angel Becomes The Moth

Mercy isn't exactly the name that comes to mind when players think of an overpowered hero, but a quick trip to the past shows off multiple instances where she dominated competitive play and tore through the ranks of supportive power alone. Launch Mercy had a nice team-wide resurrection Ultimate that could bring back her entire downed squad at the touch of a button, so long as the player was good at hide and seek.

The second was her rework, which allowed her to be far more skill-expressive, but arguably more powerful, with a multi-healing beam and enough mobility to rival even the slipperiest of characters. This, coupled with a mid-fight revive that could be used twice, ushered in the Moth meta. Although she has been taken down a few pegs, that strength remains both as a pocket support and an overall great healing choice.

2 Doomfist

Practically Unbalanceable

Doomfist can only really be described with one word: Absurd. Before being reworked into a tank, Doomfist was a beefy DPS character that could one-shot half the cast in a second and get out unscathed as if nothing ever happened. His numbers were tuned so high that they allowed players to tear through backlines with ease, giving the enemy no time to react in turn.

He continued to dominate in most games, with so much pick potential that it was hard to justify choosing any other hero at the time. Nerf after nerf, followed by his eventual rework into a frontliner, and despite being a shadow of his former glory, Doomfist still stands as an incredibly oppressive character who can solo-carry games in the right hands.

1 Brigitte

A Never-Ending Nightmare

When thinking about characters that align with the word "overpowered," there really is only one that stands out above the rest. Brigitte , for all intents and purposes, destroyed the game for well over a year by allowing for the infamous "GOATS" composition to dominate, resulting in several months of pain that were only ended with a forced role limit.

Her supportive power aside, that first Brigitte release allowed her to one-shot characters like Tracer with no way of stopping it and little input required from the player. With several changes and tweaks to her kit, she feels much more well-rounded, but that time will forever stand as one of the bleakest eras in the history of the game, cementing Brigitte as the single most overpowered character to ever enter the Overwatch roster.

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: How To Build Hysilens - Best Teams, Light Cones, & Relics In Honkai: Star Rail
item.description:
Hysilens is a Nihilty character that deals DoT DMG in Honkai: Star Rail . In order to get the best of what Hysilens can offer, here are her best build, including the best Hysilens builds, Relics, Light Cones, and teams in HSR .

Hysilens Build Overview In HSR - Honkai: Star Rail

Light Cones

  1. Why Does the Ocean Sing
  2. Reforged Remembrance
  3. Patience Is All You Need
  4. Those Many Springs
  5. Solitary Healing
  6. Good Night and Sleep Well
  7. Eyes of the Prey
  8. It's Showtime

Relics Sets

  • 4pc: Prisoner in Deep Confinement

Planar Ornaments

  • 2pc: Revelry by the Sea
  • 2pc: Pan-Cosmic Commercial Enterprise
  • 2pc: Space Sealing Station

Relics Stats

  • Body: Effect Hit Rate or ATK
  • Feet: SPD
  • Planar Sphere: ATK
  • Link Rope: Energy Regeneration Rate or ATK

Relics Substats

  • SPD, Effect Hit Rate, and ATK

Best Hysilens Teams In HSR - Honkai: Star Rail

Hysilens is an amazing DoT enabler and DPS in HSR . There are a lot of characters that can join her team since all she needs is Kafka , and the rest can just be there to support the process. Here are some of the best Hysilens teams in Honkai: Star Rail , including Hysilens F2P teams in HSR :

  • Hysilens + Kafka + Black Swan + Huohuo
  • Hysilens + Kafka + Cipher + Hyacine
  • Hysilens + Kafka + Asta + Gepard

Of course, you can also put other Harmony or Nihility characters like Robin, Ruan Mei, Tingyun, Tribbie, Guinaifen, Jiaoqiu, Luka, Pela, Sampo, and Silver Wolf.

Hysilens + Kafka + Black Swan + Huohuo

At one point, Kafka and Black Swan were one of the best pairs in HSR . However, the duo slowly fell from the meta, and the DoT gameplay fell with them. Hysilens not only revives them and their DoT gameplay, but she also makes them one of the best teams in Honkai: Star Rail .

After Kafka’s buffs, she became a solid support because of her ability to increase her team’s ATK% greatly. She’s also a must-have in every DoT team because of her insane ability to detonate DoTs on almost every single one of her attacks. As for Black Swan, she’s an enabler who effortlessly keeps building DoT on all enemies while reducing their DEF%. Finally, Hysilens needs fast characters who attack more frequently to install her DoTs. Hysilens also shares similar mechanics with Kafka and Black Swan since she can produce DMG from all DoTs and shred enemies’ DEF when she uses her Ultimate.

On the other hand, the team still needs a sustain support character like Huohuo, who can both heal and buff the team. When using her Ultimate, Huohuo buffs the team’s ATK% while giving them energy. This will help with the team’s DMG and rotation. Of course, Huohuo barely attacks enemies, so you can replace her with sustain characters that attack a lot, like Hyacine and Aventurine.

Hysilens + Kafka + Cipher + Hyacine

Walking away from classic characters like Black Swan, you can build Hysilens with a more modern team by including Cipher and Hyacine. While Cipher doesn’t have DoT mechanics, she’s still a very powerful HSR Nihility character who increases the DMG enemies take just for existing in Hysilens' team in Honkai: Star Rail . Cipher also attacks a lot and records DMG, which results in delivering devastating blows when she casts her Ultimate.

Since the team is losing an obvious DoT character, it’s important to prioritize using support units that attack frequently over Huohuo. Hyacine will keep the team healed and will never stop attacking, which will continuously trigger Hysilens and Kafka’s passives and follow-up attacks.

There are a lot of characters that can take Cipher’s place, such as Sampo, Silver Wolf, Jiaoqiu, Ruan Mei, and Tribbie. Both Kafka and Hysilens do such a great job carrying the team’s DPS; they make the third slot flexible in every HSR Hysilens team.

Hysilens + Kafka + Asta + Gepard

Going for an HSR Hysilens F2P team, Hysilens still needs Kafka in order for the team to perform. However, the third slot is flexible and can have characters like Asta or Sampo. While Sampo creates a lot of DoTs and increases their DMG, Asta greatly buffs the team’s SPD and ATK%. You can even give Asta the Dance! Dance! Dance! Light Cone to further improve the team’s rotation. Not to mention, Asta burns enemies with her Basic ATK and allows Kafka and Hysilens to play more frequently.

As for sustain options, it’s better to include Preservation units like Gepard and give him the Trend of the Universal Market Light Cone. Gepard naturally attracts more enemy attacks, and that Light Cone will burn them every time they do, scaling the burn DMG with Gepard’s DEF. As usual with F2P teams, it’s not an ideal Hysilens team in HSR , but it gets the job done.

Best Hysilens Light Cones In HSR - Honkai: Star Rail

Here are the best Hysilens Light Cones in Honkai: Star Rail :

Light Cones

Why It's Good

Why Does the Ocean Sing

It increases Hysilens’ Effect Hit Rate and buffs her DoT DMG against enemies she attacks. It also buffs the team’s SPD, which allows them to attack more, and that makes Hysilens install more DoTs.

Reforged Remembrance

Hysilens can trigger the Light Cones’ passive since she can place all types of DoTs on enemies. She gets Effect Hit Rate, ATK%, and the ability to ignore a large portion of enemies’ DEF% with her DoT DMG.

Patience Is All You Need

Since Hysilens attacks a lot, she can take full advantage of the Light Cone’s SPD and Erode effects. The Light Cone also buffs Hysilens’ DMG without meeting any requirements.

Those Many Springs

Greatly buffs Hysilens' Effect Hit Rate and grants her the ability to increase her DoT DMG by up to 24%.

Solitary Healing

Solitary Healing is a F2P Light Cone option for Hysilens in HSR . It’s a universal F2P Light Cone that can increase Hysilens' DoT DMG and regenerate a small portion of her energy.

Good Night and Sleep Well

Notably buffs Hysilens’ DMG, especially on S5.

Eyes of the Prey

Simple and straight to the point. Increases Hysilens’ Effect Hit Rate and DoT DMG.

It's Showtime

It decently increases Hysilens’ DMG and ATK% since she’s going to have enough Effect Hit Rate to hit the Light Cone’s requirement.

Best Hysilens Relics In HSR - Honkai: Star Rail

Here are the best Relics and Planar Ornaments for Hysilens in Honkai: Star Rail :

Relic Sets

Why It's Good

Prisoner in Deep Confinement

The only good option for a DoT character, since it allows them to ignore a portion of enemies’ DEF when dealing DoT DMG. It also increases Hysilens’ ATK%, which is good to increase her DPS, in general.

Planar Ornament Sets

Why It's Good

Revelry by the Sea

It increases Hysilens’ ATK% and significantly buffs her DoT DMG.

Pan-Cosmic Commercial Enterprise

If you give Hysilens ATK% on her Body Relic, this set slightly increases her Effect Hit Rate. More importantly, it also increases her ATK% based on her Effect Hit Rate.

Space Sealing Station

Simple and straight to the point. Increases Hysilens’ ATK%, especially since she’s always going to have over 120 SPD.

Hysilens Eidolons In HSR - Honkai: Star Rail

Players who want to pull for more Hysilens copies and get her Eidolons, here are her best Eidolons in HSR :

Eidolons

Effect

Importance

S1

You Ask Why Hearts Cry

While Hysilens is on the field, ally targets deal DoT equal to 116% of the original DMG. When Hysilens inflicts Wind Shear/Bleed/Burn/Shock on enemies through her Talent, there is a 100% base chance to additionally inflict the target with 1 instance of Wind Shear/Bleed/Burn/Shock state that is identical to and can coexist with that of the original Talent effect.

High

S2

Tell Me Why Waves Roar High

While the Zone is active, the DMG Boost effect from Trace "The Fiddle of Pearls" applies to all allies.

Priority

S4

Lo, How Time Flows By

While the Zone is active, reduces All-Type RES of all enemies by 20%.

High

S6

When to Return From Where You Lie

While the Zone is active, at the start of each turn or after one attack by an ally target, increases the maximum trigger count for Hysilens's Physical DoT effect to 12, and increases the multiplier of the DMG dealt by 20%.

High

item.title: Best RPGs Where Items Really Matter
item.description:
Summary

  • RPGs like Final Fantasy 10 and The Witcher 3 require a variety of consumables like potions and alchemical creations for efficient combat.
  • Games like Darkest Dungeon demand meticulous inventory management to survive status effects and limited resources.
  • Strategic use of consumable items can be crucial in RPGs like Octopath Traveler, BG 3, and Fallout NV for success in battles.

In addition to the powerful weapons and game-changing skills that players unlock over the course of a given RPG adventure, many games offer a wealth of consumable items. Players can stuff their packs with potions and curatives before setting off to take on monsters and bandits in their heroic quests.

But not every consumable item is created equal. There are plenty of RPGs out there where consumable items end up being dead weight more often than not. In other games, though, a well-timed item can turn the tide of battle. In these RPGs, success can hinge on what you have in your inventory.

10 Metaphor: ReFantazio

Cooking By The Book

Metaphor: ReFantazio
10 /10
38
8.9 /10
Released
October 11, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Blood, Language, Mild Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Developer(s)
Studio Zero
Powered by

This high-fantasy spin on the tried and true Persona formula makes a number of changes to combat. The game rewards characters, be they allies or enemies, with extra turns if they hit an enemy's weakness, and removes turns if their attack misses or is deflected. As such, elemental damage is more crucial than ever. The variety of items that let players deal damage of a certain type can help them set up some elaborate combo turns in combat.

Additionally, during downtime, players can take advantage of the game's robust cooking system, creating elaborate dishes with powerful effects. This gives them valuable options for both healing and dealing with the game's many insidious status ailments. In Metaphor: ReFantazio 's quest for the crown, it pays to be prepared.

9 Octopath Traveler

By Theft Or Trade

Octopath Traveler
8.0 /10
Released
July 13, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Fantasy Violence, Mild Language, Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol
Developer(s)
Square Enix
Powered by

Octopath Traveler is best known for pioneering the HD-2D art style that's now common among retro RPGs. But the game has a lot of other features to set it apart from other RPGs, most notably its roster of eight playable characters, each of which has different means of interacting with the world. The Merchant and Thief characters, for instance, can buy from or rob passing NPCs respectively, keeping the party's item stocks full.

This is important, because items are vital to combat in Octopath Traveler . Players are encouraged to exploit enemies' elemental weaknesses to gain an edge, so items that deal specific types of damage are integral to coming out on top, as are the usual healing and status items familiar to most JRPG fans.

8 Clair Obscur: Expedition 33

The Right Tint

10 Images
10 Images
Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
143
9.4 /10
Released
April 24, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Sandfall Interactive
Powered by

Setting aside the truly potent Pictos and weapons used to enhance the characters in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , the library of consumable items is relatively small. Players have a small assortment of Tints to consume in battle. These elixirs will either heal characters, revive them from being knocked out, or give them energy points to use on their special moves.

As fans upgrade the capabilities of these items over the course of the game, they'll become more and more integral to the flow of combat. Feeding a character a substantial number of action points at a critical moment can help them dish out immense amounts of damage. The other major consumable item, Colours of Lumina, lets characters equip even more Luminas, unlocking potent new moves for them.

7 The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

Supplying The Dragonborn

6 Images
6 Images
The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
9 /10
80
9.5 /10
Released
November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol
Developer(s)
Bethesda Game Studios
Powered by

Skyrim is stuffed to the gills with potions. In addition to the standard potions for refilling health, magicka, and stamina, players can find potions that make their armor and weapons more effective, increase certain skills, poison their foes, and everything in between. With the game's robust alchemy system, players can even brew their own potions from ingredients they recover across the game's open world.

Potions are far from the only consumable item fans can take advantage of. Spell tomes give players new incantations to wield, while soul gems let them keep their enchanted weapons charged and ready to use. There are a lot of valuable items to keep on hand if players want to be well-equipped as they wander the wilds of Skyrim.

6 Baldur's Gate 3

Unconventional Solutions

Baldur's Gate 3
9 /10
140
9.7 /10
Released
August 3, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Larian Studios
Powered by

In its quest to replicate the experience of playing Dungeons & Dragons , Baldur's Gate 3 has included an extensive library of potions for players to utilize in combat. Fans can stuff their inventories with much more than just potions, however. The game is rich with variety and versatility, and the Tav can pick up just about anything that might help.

Players can take encounters in some truly bizarre directions by keeping items like explosive barrels handy and using them to turn the tide of combat. Exploring the landscape will often reveal a lot of items that can be turned into useful tools with enough imagination.

5 Final Fantasy 10

Putting It Together

5 Images
5 Images
Final Fantasy 10
25
9.7 /10
Released
December 17, 2001

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Mild Blood, Mild Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Square Enix
Powered by

The Final Fantasy franchise is an archetypal JRPG with all the usual item types one would expect. Final Fantasy 10 is no exception, with a wide variety of items on offer to help players stay alive in some of its tougher encounters. Especially in the early game, consumable items are valuable for keeping status conditions in check.

Later in the game, the introduction of Rikku gives consumable items new life. This character is entirely built around using items in battle, and even combining multiple consumables to create strange and unexpected new effects. FFX players should make regular use of the many shops along the way to keep their party well-stocked and ready.

4 The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

A Hunter's Tools

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
54
9.4 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content
Developer(s)
CD Projekt Red
Powered by

As any fan of the Witcher franchise will attest, it's important to have the right equipment on hand when hunting a creature. The Witcher 3 simulates the hunt brilliantly, with a wide array of alchemical creations for players to arm themselves with before they go hunting.

In addition to standard potions, as seen in other prominent fantasy games, The Witcher 3 includes a robust mutagen system. This lets players alter Geralt's very being in order to activate specific buffs and make sure he's ready for whatever challenges await him in his quest.

3 Bloodborne

Fear the Old Blood

6 Images
6 Images
Bloodborne
22
9.1 /10
Released
March 24, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Violence
Developer(s)
From Software
Powered by

FromSoftware's soulsborne games have always had a rich array of consumable items, with varying degrees of utility, but Bloodborne in particular encourages players to kit themselves out with consumable tools. The game's primary healing method, for instance, is a consumable that players will need to hoard desperately throughout the game. The same goes for ammunition for the title's vicious firearms.

In addition to these two core resources, players can also build out their kit with Molotov cocktails and fire paper to exploit the greatest weakness of the beasts roaming the streets of Yharnam. Restoratives like antidotes and sedatives are also vital in dealing with the deadly status conditions players might pick up during the hunt.

2 Fallout: New Vegas

Post-Apocalyptic Prospecting

Fallout: New Vegas
8 /10
22
8.9 /10
Released
October 19, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Developer(s)
Obsidian Entertainment
Powered by

Inventory management is critical in Fallout: New Vegas . Combat in this game can be punishing, especially at low levels, so having a robust stock of healing items on hand is crucial. More esoteric consumables like skill books and magazines can shift key dialogue scenes, which can have significant ramifications.

The versatility and utility of consumable items goes beyond healing and skill aid. Specific types of chem can bring major boons as well, like a potent damage buff or the ability to resist harm, though the chance of addiction makes them quite risky to use. Players can even equip different types of bullets in their guns, giving them potentially more valuable options against certain foes.

1 Darkest Dungeon

Don't Skip Supply

Darkest Dungeon
9 /10
8.6 /10
Released
January 19, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Alcohol Reference, Blood and Gore, Mild Language, Partial Nudity, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Red Hook Studios
Powered by

There are few games where inventory management is a more dire matter of life and death than in Darkest Dungeon . The items a player purchases for a given mission are very often the difference between success and crushing failure, as untreated status effects like Bleeding and Blight can prove disastrous for a character without access to the proper curatives.

Players will also need to pack a ready supply of torches to keep the halls lit. If the light goes out, the game's already crushing difficulty will skyrocket. Without enough food on hand, characters will also starve. The game's limited inventory means fans will often have to make hard choices about what to keep and what to discard, and those choices can have devastating consequences.

item.title: All GameCube Games Coming to the Nintendo Switch 2 (So Far)
item.description:
The Nintendo GameCube originally came out over 20 years ago now, and since then, there has been no official way to download some of the most iconic games of all time on a Nintendo console... until the Switch 2. Now, Nintendo isn't releasing its entire library of GameCube games at the same time, but will more than likely drip-feed the catalog to keep Switch 2 players waiting.

On day one, only three GameCube games came out on the Switch 2, and this guide will go over those games and everything else coming to the console.

Updated on August 12, 2025: We updated this list of GameCube games and added Chibi-Robo's release date for Switch 2, which is August 21, 2025.

All GameCube Games on Nintendo Switch 2

So Far...

If you are subscribed to Switch Online's Expansion Pack and own a Switch 2, you have access to the following GameCube games:

  • The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker - Released June 5, 2025
  • F-Zero GX - Released June 5, 2025
  • SoulCalibur 2 (featuring Link!) - Released June 5, 2025
  • Super Mario Strikers - Released July 3, 2025
  • Chibi-Robo! Plug Into Adventure! - Out August 21, 2025

Not only do GC games look a little bit better than their original formats, but fans can use a retro CRT mode, suspend points, and online and local wireless play (for multiplayer-supported games). Of course, you can also use GameChat if you would like to hear your friends cry when you take them down in SoulCalibur or demolish them in a F-Zero GX race.

GameCube Games Coming in the Future...

Where's Smash Bros. Melee?

When Nintendo first announced that GameCube games were coming to Switch, they showcased several other titles that would eventually be available on the service. However, none of these games have release windows yet. Here are the games we know about so far...

  • Pokemon Colosseum
  • Pokemon XD: Gale of Darkness
  • Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance
  • Luigi's Mansion
  • Super Mario Sunshine

How Much Are GameCube Games on Switch 2?

There's a Catch!

So, for the time being, Nintendo Switch 2 owners cannot purchase and own digital GameCube games. The only way to play them is by subscribing to Switch Online's Expansion Pack, which costs $50 a year. You will also be able to check out the N64, Game Boy Advance, and Sega Genesis' library of games, including some DLC, like Happy Home Paradise for Animal Crossing: New Horizons and the single-player-focused Octo Expansion for Splatoon 2 .

How to Get the GameCube Controller for Switch 2

For NSO Members Only

Unfortunately, if you want to get your hands on one of the snazzy new GameCube controllers for the Switch 2, not only will you need to be subscribed to Nintendo Switch Online, but you can only get it right now via Nintendo's official storefront. However, as of the time of writing, the $64.99 throwback controller is unavailable for pre-order/purchase, so you might have to wait until after launch if you haven't pre-ordered already.

The GameCube controller will have a USB-C port, a GameChat button, and a Capture button. For now, it seems that you'll only be able to use the controller for the GameCube titles through Switch Online.

item.title: Clair Obscur Expedition 33: Frozen Hearts 100% Collectibles Guide
item.description:
The icy lands of Frozen Hearts in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 contain secrets waiting to be found. Beyond the main story, you can discover a variety of collectibles scattered throughout the vast and challenging environments. These items are tied to the game's lore, offering new insights into the world and its inhabitants. Finding them all requires a thorough exploration of every corner of the region. The guide below provides information on all collectibles in Frozen Hearts in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 .

Frozen Hearts Location In Expedition 33

To get to Frozen Hearts, players must progress through the second act of the game . After a certain Gestral joins your party, you will need to make your way out of Monoco's Station . The station has multiple exits: the one on the south functions more as an entrance; the one to the northwest leads to your next main story location; and the one to the northeast leads to an icy plain with the Frozen Hearts portal at the far end .

Traveling there should not be a problem with Esquie at your side.

Frozen Hearts Collectibles In Expedition 33

Color of Lumina #1

As you go through the portal, you must go past the steps to reach an area with broken train compartments. To the right of the front part of the train is the first Colour of Lumina .

Color of Lumina #2

After grabbing the previous collectible, head to the main path, and when you spot the flag on the left, look to the right to find a broken train track with the Color of Lumina at the end.

Burning Death (Pictos)

  • Nearest Flag: Icebound Train Station

Interact with the flag and head across the track to spot the first enemy towards the right. Defeat them to get the Burning Death (Pictos).​​​​​​​

Color of Lumina #3

Immediately turn around after the previous fight, and you can find the Color of Lumina on top of a broken-down train compartment .

Glaceso (Verso's Weapon)

From the first flag, head across the track and turn left towards the blue enemy, who will drop the weapon for Verso once defeated.​​​​​​​

Journal (Expedition 51)

After defeating the blue enemy, turn right and follow the path leading towards the middle area. Do not go down the rope ; the path in the middle is what you need to take . As you approach the area, you can spot the journal on the right next to a few expedition member corpses.​​​​​​​

Color of Lumina #4

Head left from the journal location, and when the train compartment is on your left, stick to the left path to find the Color Lumina. You will know you are on the correct path when you can spot the same area ahead where you fought the blue enemy for Vero's weapon.​​​​​​​

Color of Lumina #5

​​​​​​​Go slightly back to where the train compartment was on your left. Facing the previous Color of Lumina, head right through the ice tunnel to reach a rope that leads up to the next Flag . From the Flag, turn around and head right. Instead of going left for the stairs, look to your right to spot a few Bells, next to which is the Color of Lumina.​​​​​​​

Burning Break (Pictos)

From the previous Color of Lumina, head up the path on the right, and you will spot a place where you can jump to the nearby platform with a Nevron corpse . Next to the corpse, is the Pictos for you to grab.​​​​​​​

Color of Lumina #6

  • Nearest Flag: Glacial Falls

From the flag, turn around and head right, past the enemy and towards the stairs up ahead. Go up the stairs, turn left, and make your way to the end of the tracks to find the fifth Color of Lumina.​​​​​​​

Danseuse (Lune's Outfit)

Drop down from the previous collectible to find three Danseuse Apprentices and a Danseuse Teacher . Talk to the teacher, and you'll have to fight her. The key to winning this fight is to parry all of her attacks and use the counterattack as a means of damage. Once you defeat her, you'll get the outfit for Lune .​​​​​​​

Augmented Counter III (Pictos)

After acquiring the outfit, you can talk to the teacher again and fight her in a real fight, which will give you the Pictos.

However, keep in mind that if you are attempting to avoid fighting any of the White Nevrons, it is best to leave this Pictos for now and return after you have completed all interactions with the White Nevrons and acquired the 100 Color of Lumina reward.​​​​​​​

Energising Burn (Pictos)

From the flag, go up the path on the right, and at the end you will spot a grapple that takes you to the other side and down to a cave. In the center of the area is the Chromatic Veilleur roaming that you must defeat to get the Pictos.​​​​​​​

Clea! Don't Pull Your Sister's Hair! (Music Record)

Right next to the Chromatic mini boss, is a door to the Manor . Head inside to find the Music Record next to the Harp.

Grandoise Chroma Catalyst #1

Exit the Manor, head straight all the way, and take the second left to find the upgrade material.​​​​​​​

Grandoise Chroma Catalyst #2

To the left of the Manor Door, on top of the table beside the frozen Nevron.​​​​​​​

Burn Affinity (Pictos)

Facing the Manor door, head right and keep going straight until you reach the end of the train compartment to find the Pictos.​​​​​​​

Anti Freeze (Pictos)

Facing the Manor Door, head left and keep going past the two Nevrons. Here you will find a Paint Cage that requires three locks to open. The first lock is on top of the Cage ; the second lock is on the arm of the crane ; and the third lock is opposite the Cage next to some frozen spikes . Once the Cage is opened, grab the Pictos.​​​​​​​

Grandoise Chroma Catalyst #3

From the flag, take the path on the right that goes towards the two fire enemies, and towards the end is the third upgrade material inside Frozen Hearts.​​​​​​​

Grandoise Chroma Catalyst #4

Head up the rope on the side from the previous collectible and go past the fire enemies. You will need to grapple across to reach a small area with climbing anchors. Head up the anchors halfway and head right to find this upgrade material .​​​​​​​

Stalum (Malle's Weapon)

Go back to the anchors, and this time go left . Once you reach the next area, ignore all the smaller Nevrons and go for the Stalact on the right who will drop this weapon for Maelle .​​​​​​​

Grandoise Chroma Catalyst #5

From the previous collectible, head right towards the building up ahead, and turn right. Here you can climb some platforms to reach the upgrade material.​​​​​​​

Revive Tinct Shard

From the anchors, head left to find a fire enemy and a Paint Cage at the end. The first lock is on the eye of the Grandis statue to the right of the Cage; the second lock is on the train compartment next to the dead Grandis ; and the third lock is to the left of the Cage on top of a platform . This opens the Cage, allowing you to pick up the Tinct Shard.

Petank

Head down the platform and go right towards the piano to spot the Petank next to it. You need to drive it to the other corner where it will get stuck, allowing you to defeat it for the materials.

Color of Lumina #7

  • Nearest Flag: Iced Heart

Head past the second Stalact in the middle of the area to go through the narrow passage leading to the next Flag. Turn left from the Flag, to find this collectible.​​​​​​​

Pelerin (Verso's Outfit) & Danseuse (Sciel's Outfit)

Head up the train compartments in front of the flag, and you should be able to grapple your way to the floating compartments. Do not take the grapple on the right; instead, head left towards the merchant . The merchant is selling an outfit for Verso for 20,000 and an outfit for Sciel for 10,000.​​​​​​​

Color of Lumina #8

Head past the merchant to find the Color of Lumina behind some boxes.​​​​​​​

Grandoise Chroma Catalyst #6

From the merchant, head right to find this next to the first set of boxes.​​​​​​​

Grandoise Chroma Catalyst #7

Go past the previous upgrade material to find this collectible at the very end.​​​​​​​

Short Hair (Lune's Haircut)

Defeat the Mime in the middle of this area to get the haircut for Lune .

Snowim (Weapon), Anti Burn (Pictos) & Eternal Ice (Quest Item)

  • Nearest Flag: Icebound Terminal

From the merchant, go back one grapple point, turn around to spot a path going up to the next flag. Here you can fight Gargant who drops the following items:

  • Grandiose Chroma Catalyst x3
  • Anti-Burn Pictos
  • Snowim Weapon
  • Eternal Ice
